results.title: BYO: sprung
results.creator_credit: Eric Mival and Queensland.Dept. of Education. Production Services Branch
results.brief_description: One in a series of films following BYO, this episode revolves around the attitudes of the parents whose teenage son comes home drunk. A discussion starter for teenagers. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: BYO: spiked
results.creator_credit: Eric Mival and Queensland.Dept. of Education. Production Services Branch
results.brief_description: One of a series of films following BYO. In this episode the attempts of some parents to allow moderate drinking at a party are thwarted by gatecrashers. A discussion starter for teenagers. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Bylines
results.brief_description: A program that looks inside the Sydney Morning Herald and the staff who put the paper together. “Bylines” takes the audience from the early arrival of the Chief of Staff, through the daily drama of leaks, phone tappings and piracy on the high seas to the convoy of trucks heading into the night with the first edition.

results.title: Bygone Britain: the nation on film
results.creator_credit: George Lillington, Allan Follett and Byambasuren Davaa
results.brief_description: A historical glimpse of Britain using archival film from a collection of old film clips from widely different sources which represents and reflects some of the long forgotten images of life in Britain from the early 1930’s to the 1960’s. Includes footage of Britain in wartime, royal visits, traditional fairs and other celebrations of a bygone era. Most of the footage comes from amateur filmmakers around Great Britain. Narrated by Chris Champion.

results.title: Bye Bye Bye
results.brief_description: In the year 2000, *Nsync waved bye, bye, bye to their second place status in the boy band race with the Backstreet Boys with this certified hit that’s music video memorably featured the troupe dancing on puppet strings.

constellations_other.name: Like a puppet on a string
constellations_other.description: From the silly to the sinister, puppets, muppets, dummies and toys on-screen.
